intro: Asplenium basiscopicum, commonly known as the upward-pointing spleenwort, is a small, epiphytic fern belonging to the family Aspleniaceae. It typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in humid, shaded environments, often in temperate regions. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a rosette-like pattern, with the tips of the fronds pointing upward. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the leaves, a characteristic feature of many ferns. Asplenium basiscopicum is noted for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its relatively simple, elegant morphology.
